l:dependency.name: Maven Integration plugin
l:dependency.l:description: This plug-in provides deep integration of Jenkins and Maven. This functionality used to be part of the Jenkins core. Now it is a plug-in that is installed by default, but can be disabled.

l:dependency.name: Aether :: SPI
l:dependency.l:description: The service provider interface for repository system implementations and repository connectors.

l:dependency.name: SLF4J API Module
l:dependency.l:description: The slf4j API

l:dependency.name: Jackrabbit WebDAV Library
l:dependency.l:description: WebDAV library used by the Jackrabbit WebDAV support

l:dependency.name: Jackrabbit JCR Commons
l:dependency.l:description: General purpose classes for use with the JCR API

l:dependency.name: Guava: Google Core Libraries for Java
l:dependency.l:description:
Guava is a suite of core and expanded libraries that include utility classes, google's collections, io classes, and much much more.
This project is a complete packaging of all the Guava libraries into a single jar. Individual portions of Guava can be used by downloading the appropriate module and its dependencies.
Guava (complete) has only one code dependency - javax.annotation, per the JSR-305 spec.

l:dependency.name: Commons Logging
l:dependency.l:description: Commons Logging is a thin adapter allowing configurable bridging to other, well known logging systems.

l:dependency.name: Maven Reporting API
l:dependency.l:description: API to manage report generation.

l:dependency.name: Maven Artifact
l:dependency.l:description: Maven is a project development management and comprehension tool. Based on the concept of a project object model: builds, dependency management, documentation creation, site publication, and distribution publication are all controlled from the declarative file. Maven can be extended by plugins to utilise a number of other development tools for reporting or the build process.

l:dependency.name: Apache Maven Wagon :: Providers :: File Provider
l:dependency.l:description: Wagon that gets and puts artifacts using file system protocol

l:dependency.name: Maven Model Builder
l:dependency.l:description: Maven is a project development management and comprehension tool. Based on the concept of a project object model: builds, dependency management, documentation creation, site publication, and distribution publication are all controlled from the declarative file. Maven can be extended by plugins to utilise a number of other development tools for reporting or the build process.

l:dependency.name: Maven Core
l:dependency.l:description: Maven is a project development management and comprehension tool. Based on the concept of a project object model: builds, dependency management, documentation creation, site publication, and distribution publication are all controlled from the declarative file. Maven can be extended by plugins to utilise a number of other development tools for reporting or the build process.

l:dependency.name: JSch
l:dependency.l:description: JSch is a pure Java implementation of SSH2

l:dependency.name: XML Commons External Components XML APIs
l:dependency.l:description: xml-commons provides an Apache-hosted set of DOM, SAX, and JAXP interfaces for use in other xml-based projects. Our hope is that we can standardize on both a common version and packaging scheme for these critical XML standards interfaces to make the lives of both our developers and users easier. The External Components portion of xml-commons contains interfaces that are defined by external standards organizations. For DOM, that's the W3C; for SAX it's David Megginson and sax.sourceforge.net; for JAXP it's Sun.

l:dependency.name: Apache Maven Wagon :: Providers :: HTTP Shared Library
l:dependency.l:description: Shared Library for the wagon-http, and wagon-http-lightweight wagon providers.

l:dependency.name: Apache Maven Wagon :: Providers :: WebDav Provider
l:dependency.l:description: Wagon that gets and puts artifacts through webdav protocol

l:dependency.name: Commons Net
l:dependency.l:description: Apache Commons Net library contains a collection of network utilities and protocol implementations. Supported protocols include: Echo, Finger, FTP, NNTP, NTP, POP3(S), SMTP(S), Telnet, Whois

l:dependency.name: Aether :: Connector :: Wagon
l:dependency.l:description: A repository connector implementation based on Maven Wagon.

l:dependency.name: HttpClient
l:dependency.l:description: The HttpClient component supports the client-side of RFC 1945 (HTTP/1.0) and RFC 2616 (HTTP/1.1) , several related specifications (RFC 2109 (Cookies) , RFC 2617 (HTTP Authentication) , etc.), and provides a framework by which new request types (methods) or HTTP extensions can be created easily.

l:dependency.name: Maven Aether Provider
l:dependency.l:description: This module provides extensions to Aether for utilizing the Maven POM and Maven metadata.

l:dependency.name: Aether :: Utilities
l:dependency.l:description: A collection of utility classes to ease usage of the repository system.

l:dependency.l:description: AOP Alliance

l:dependency.name: Aether :: Implementation
l:dependency.l:description: An implementation of the repository system.

l:dependency.name: Commons CLI
l:dependency.l:description: Commons CLI provides a simple API for presenting, processing and validating a command line interface.

l:dependency.name: org.apache.tools.ant
l:dependency.l:description: Apache Ant

l:dependency.name: Maven Settings
l:dependency.l:description: Maven Settings

l:dependency.name: Plexus Interpolation API
l:dependency.l:description: The Plexus project provides a full software stack for creating and executing software projects.

Based on the concept of a project object model: builds, dependency management, documentation creation, site publication, and distribution publication are all controlled from the declarative file. l:dependency.l:description: Wagon that gets and puts artifacts using SSH protocol with a preinstalled SSH client

l:dependency.name: Commons IO
l:dependency.l:description: Commons-IO contains utility classes, stream implementations, file filters, file comparators and endian classes.

l:dependency.name: FindBugs-jsr305
l:dependency.l:description: JSR305 Annotations for Findbugs

l:dependency.name: Apache Maven Wagon :: Providers :: SSH Provider
l:dependency.l:description: Tools to manage artifacts and deployment

l:dependency.l:description: Per-directory repository metadata.

l:dependency.l:description: Wagon that gets and puts artifacts from and to remote server using FTP protocol

l:dependency.l:description: The application programming interface for the repository system.

l:dependency.l:description: Patched build of Guice: a lightweight dependency injection framework for Java 5 and above

l:dependency.name: Plexus Common Utilities
l:dependency.l:description: A collection of various utility classes to ease working with strings, files, command lines, XML and more.

l:dependency.name: Apache Maven Wagon :: API
l:dependency.l:description: Maven Wagon API that defines the contract between different Wagon implementations

l:dependency.name: Commons Codec
l:dependency.l:description: The codec package contains simple encoder and decoders for various formats such as Base64 and Hexadecimal. In addition to these widely used encoders and decoders, the codec package also maintains a collection of phonetic encoding utilities.

l:dependency.name: Xerces2 Java Parser
l:dependency.l:description: Xerces2 is the next generation of high performance, fully compliant XML parsers in the Apache Xerces family. This new version of Xerces introduces the Xerces Native Interface (XNI), a complete framework for building parser components and configurations that is extremely modular and easy to program.

l:dependency.name: Plexus Classworlds
l:dependency.l:description: A class loader framework

l:dependency.l:description: The javax.inject API

l:dependency.l:description: Wagon that gets and puts artifacts through http using Apache httpclient-4.x.

l:dependency.l:description: Tools to manage artifacts and deployment

l:dependency.l:description: Maven Model

l:dependency.l:description: Plexus Component "Java 5" Annotations, to describe plexus components properties in java sources with standard annotations instead of javadoc annotations.

l:dependency.l:description: hackhish version of artifact manager to continue support uniqueVersion = false with maven2 builds

l:dependency.l:description: Code that boots up Maven2 with Jenkins's remoting support in place. Used for the native maven support.

l:dependency.l:description: Plexus module that intercepts invocations of key Maven components so that Jenkins can monitor what's going on in Maven.
